title: Registered Nursing Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very organized 3 scenario questions for unit 3scct 1) What would I monitor for pt taking lasix 2) what to do if pt is still complaining of pain after already getting pain meds 3) what dx do I think a pt has if they’re shaky, confused, sweaty and weak? 4) what to do if a pt was trying to climb out of bed and was confused
Interview Questions: There were like 3 scenario questions: 1) What would I monitor for pt taking lasix 2) what to do if pt is still complaining of pain after already getting pain meds 3) what dx do I think a pt has if they’re shaky, confused, sweaty and weak? 4) what to do if a pt was trying to climb out of bed and was confused

title: Senior Backend Engineer (Node Js) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Passed a Node.js TestDome online text with 6 questions. High-level technical interview covering HTTP methods, API design best practices, and database design. Interview with hiring manager was mainly interested in background and experience directly related to the role such as AWS and Node.js. I did well in the technical interviews. My background and experience was not a complete match. It would have been nice to find this out earlier than later in the interview process.
Interview Questions: HTTP methods, API design best practices, and database design.

title: Research Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: One interview with four managers across several departments. They moved quickly with an offer and the HR talent advisor called with offer details and next steps. Did not hear as much information about the job as desired.
Interview Questions: Experience, ability to manage staff

title: RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Video interview with a panel. Behavioral questions regarding ability to collaborate, experience as bedside nurse, and experience in any utilization management or care coordination. Also asked me about how I deal with conflict in the workplace
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a difficult patient?

title: Junior Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: I received an invitation to a Teams video call. It involved the PI and a person from HR ( which I didn't know would be included in the interview). It was a tag team effort from both of them as they asked me about my work experience. Not gonna lie the posted salary for the position was low so I brought it up towards the end of the interview and the PI person kinda shut down after that. The HR person got real defensive about it and said it was determined via an aggressive market analysis tool ( or whatever) Pretty sure I made a mistake by asking that, but the entire time of the interview it felt like they were looking for a friend/buddy to join their team instead of someone who's qualified to do the work. I guess it's fair because fit is important, but they both gave me catty/you can't sit with us vibes with their questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your research experiences. They asked some behavioral questions too.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I got interviewed via Microsoft Teams with the manager. The interview lasted for 15 minutes. Most of the questions are about the work scenarios and how to handle them. The manager said there were 15 candidates who applied for the job. Unfortunately, I didn’t get in.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress and conflict?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Extremely professional interaction - behavioral based interview questions were used throughout, very transparent about needs of the role as well as pay rage. Would recommend doing research on role prior to initial phone call if possible.
Interview Questions: Asked to describe different times I had encountered situations covered in the job description

title: Frontend Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen then a second round where I had to complete a coding assessment online. There were 5 questions: 2 focused on HTML/CSS and the remaining 3 were JavaScript specific (one was multiple choice and the last two were algo & data structures). Make sure you have a good grasp of responsive design.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have with HTML, CSS, and JS?

title: Rehab Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: mostly fair questions asked during process. questions were related to field and easy to communicate with those asking the questions. process was fair and all of the staff seemed to be organized
Interview Questions: unsure of questions asked during processionals

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Leadership interviews, 1:1 or 2-3:1. Then usually have a group lunch interview with the team. If you make it past those interviews, you may be asked to interview with leadership of teams you will be working with.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you think you'd be a good fit.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy, technology friendly. All process was done via email. 1 screen via phone and 2nd interview via zoom. Waiting on response. Fast and easy, technology friendly. All process was done via email. 1 screen via phone and 2nd interview via zoom. Waiting on response.

title: Clinical Dietitian Interview

Interview Descriptions: Great interview with nutrition service staff. Be familiar with medical nutrition therapy and enteral/parenteral nutrition. Very large department and great staff. Nice facility at all of their locations and the supervising staff are all knowledgeable.

title: New Grad Interview

- tell me about yourself

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interviewed last year
Zoom interview with nurse manager and assistant manager 
They kind of just want to see your personality and ask fee scenario questions

title: Social Media Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I applied on LinkedIn and was contacted via email to set up a 30 minute Zoom interview with the hiring manager. Their availability wasn't until 2 weeks out. Interview was fine and felt conversational. They let me know they are holding a few other interviews this week but that I should hear back after. I never heard back so I followed up to ask for any updates. I waited a couple more weeks and then ended up sending one more follow up email just in case but they never responded. I understand that people are busy but I believe candidates deserve better than being ghosted.
Interview Questions:
- Describe a successful campaign you were involved in.
- Why health care?
- Have you ever dealt with a social media crisis?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions: seamless, easy and well planned. had a great chat with the attending and followed up with second interview to confirm interest. The interviewer was well prepared and asked appropriate questions and genuinely wanted to get to know me which was refreshing.
Interview Questions: describe a difficult patient you experienced in the ER and how you handled it.

title: Clinical Research Budget and Contract Coordinator Interview

Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview that asked questions to try and see what I'm like as a person. Zoom interview with finance team. Final zoom interview with finance manager. Both zoom meetings assessed my previous experience
Interview Questions: How I can leverage my past experience to succeed in this new role

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Associate II Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Data Scientist Interview

title: Research Associate Interview

title: Operations Analyst Interview

Interview Descriptions:

title: Clinical Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
There were 4 Rounds:
First Round: A screening call with the associate director. The questions were mainly related to prior experience and why I would be a good fit.
Second Round: Interview with the technical director. Expect a few basic questions on probability and Machine Learning. 
Third Round: This was a take home coding assignment which had to be completed in 1hr. I had to solve 2 out of 3 questions. 
Fourth Round: This was with the associate director and consisted of some behavioral questions and do a background check.
Interview Questions: Not allowed to disclose. But expect some questions related to the role. For me it was related to probability and machine learning.

title: RN I Interview

title: Clinical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very long and tedious. A recruiter reached out to me on LinkedIn for this open role, to which I replied via email and applied on the job portal. Next I had a phone interview with the HR, and followed by a 30 min Zoom meeting with the director. The interview went well and it was the interviews after that that became really tedious. I had to meet with 9 different team members (30-45 mins each) over the course of 4 days! I understand that they were trying to find the best candidate for their role, but a part of me truly wished they were a little more considerate about candidate experience as much as they cared about finding the perfect candidate.
Interview Questions: Why do you choose to work in Cedars Sinai?

title: RN Interview

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview

title: Reasearch Associate Interview

title: Clinical Dietitian I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Disjointed Talent Acquisition Team seems to all work independently on different listings, so three of them were all contacting me in different ways for different listings. They all ask different things of you...it's a mess. I ended up speaking to one recruiter via phone and all he wanted to do was talk about how amazing Cedars is and all the benefits and these different employees who had been there for decades. He didn't even ask me a single question about my resume.  He then said he would be forwarding my information to the hiring manager and was very positive and I never heard from her.  Then another one sent me both a LinkedIn email and an actual email asking for me to set up and interview and when I responded to him, no follow through, literally crickets.  They just don't have it together.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: CRC I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening with team menagaet, then team zoom and then individual PI interview. Very easy to scedule. About a 3 week process. Very flexible. Team asks array of questions ranging from technical to personality questions. Very respectful of time
Interview Questions: What does youre CRC experience translate to this work

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was not what i expected, I thought it would be an interview with one person, the one who reached out to me, but upon arrival I was interviewed first by the Team Lead’s assistant, for about 30 minutes, then she said she would call the Team Lead to ask follow up questions, I spoke to her for a bit longer than 30 minutes, the TL then gave me a tour & walked me to the director, who was the original person who contacted me. The first two ladies asked me very similar questions, with the Team Lead elaborating more on scheduling, as I applied for a per diem position. The director of the facility was incredibly nice and spoke with me for about 30 mins. He made me aware that he thought I would be a great fit and that they would be making a decision soon because they were looking to fill the position ASAP. I wasn’t even half way home when I got a phone call from HR asking me to submit references. Once I did, he contacted me hours later with a job offer. Over all it was an amazing experience to be interviewed here. I think if i had known 3 people would be interviewing me back to back ahead of time, I would have stressed myself out and done a poor job during the interview, so im glad it was a surprise. I applied on a Monday, was contacted the next morning, and I chose to be interviewed on Thursday because I couldn’t come in Wednesday, and was offered the job on Friday. 
One thing I found interesting was that there was no phone screen, just an in person interview invitation...I was expecting definitely expecting Cedars Sinai to first conduct a phone interview, as I’m sure they are very selective, but I’m not complaining! I’m much better at in person interviews.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself in one word.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview done first. Was told to give her my schedule so that she could set up an interview with the hiring manager.  Gave her my schedule. Did not hear from her. Sent a follow up email and still no response.
Interview Questions: State 3 characteristics that make you a good nurse.

title: Lab Tech Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview was very brief. Wait time was long. Staff running the flow of interviews were very friendly. The unit managers I interviewed with were not personable or excited to do the interviews

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Research Associate 1 Interview

Standard interview process 
They told me about the current  work of the lab. Introductory Information, Questions regarding my ability to multitask and communicate as well as future goals related to education and professional development

title: Medical Assistant Interview

Received an invitation to an in person interview for 8/14/2020. The interview was fine. It was a panel of 2 RN’s. 1 manager and the other Assistant Manager. Questions were basic and felt more like a meet and greet more than anything. Very comfortable environment. I got a tour after interview. Left the interview feeling good. After leaving the parking lot I received an offer from HR. The first step was a reference check. After this, the acceptance letter and background check begin. It is now 8/27/2020. My background and reference check has been cleared. And my start date is set for 9/14/2020. The process was fast. I’m excited to start.
Interview Questions: Tells us about an upset patient and how you dealt with....

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview

Was given date and time for second interview. On given date, nobody called.  I took PTO hours to accommodate the meeting.
There was no communication the interview was cancelled.  This is beyond unprofessionalism.

title: Research Associate II Interview

title: Research Associate Interview

title: New Grad Registered Nurse Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Due to COVID-19, we were the interview process that took longer than anticipated. I waited outside with others 6-ft apart for about 40-50 minutes since limited individuals were able to go up the elevator and be in the same space together. Once I was called in for the actual interview, it was only me with the interviewer. She was nice and asked several interview-like questions and clinical questions. The only negative comment I have to say is that her phone was vibrating and she would take a look at it which was very distracting during the interview. It sucked that I had to wear a mask the entire time cause of COVID. Other than that, the interview was very intense compared to any other interview process I had experienced.
Interview Questions: Signs and Symptoms of Lasix

title: Clinical Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took a year or more. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It doesn’t seem like anyone here wants to call back people of colour unless they apply to security guard or receptionist, or some kind of lowly position.  I had 2 phone screenings and one of them was followed up by a second meeting that was face to face.  I understand these positions are competitive but I’m qualified, a human being, and deserve for someone to have the decency to follow up with me and let me know what’s going on.  5 months pass and not a word.  If I were another colour and dressed to blend in with the office furniture things may have turned out different.  The other interview was on the phone but I knew the girl knew me - when I emailed her some additional questions pertaining to our conversation, she never wrote back. This is now a week and half later and she’s acts like I was some country bumpkin trying to get by. This is incredibly rude and disrespectful
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview to set a day and time for a face to face conversation.  Onsite interview was first with the principal investigator, followed by the project scientist.  Then the lab manager gave me a tour of the lab and asked me questions about my previous research experience. The whole interview process lasted 1-1.5 hours total.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience and what are my goals in 5 to 10 years.

title: Certified Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer was great and I left the interview feeling really good. Lasted for about 20 minutes and I spent another 20 minutes being shown around the office. Office staff was friendly and eager to teach even though it was an interview stage.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you are applying for this job.

title: Physician Billing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA)
Interview Descriptions: It was quick and easy.  I interviewed first with the director of revenue cycle for one position she did not believe i was qualified for but she thought i would make a great fit within one of her departments so she passed on my resume to one of the billing managers  2 weeks later i went in and did a panel i did a panel interview with the manager and supervisor.   That was about it.

title: Clinical Partner Interview

Fast interview just asked basic questions.          Fast interview just asked basic questions  
 Fast interview just asked basic questions

title: Registered Nurse, Ambulatory Care Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2019

Interview Questions: Strengths, weaknesses, goals

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process from phone screen to in person interview was very smooth. Staff was accommodating and very down to earth. Had a tour of the hospital as well as meet the team members.
Interview Questions: What sets you apart from your peers?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Completed a one-way video interview through Montage. First section is introduction, which you can record an unlimited amount of times. Second section were the timed questions. You have 2 minutes to answer each question (5 questions total). Allowed you to record your answer 3 times before submitting.
Interview Questions: Why are you the right person for the New Grad Residency Program? Why should we hire you?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Upon arrival to the auditorium where interviews take place, you will check in at the front, give them your portfolio, and give them the unit you want to interview for. They take your portfolio and put it in a stack for the unit you want, then you proceed to wait in the auditorium with other candidates. Each unit has a table (tables are set up around the room) and call candidates one by one.  You can see people interviewing but you can't really hear since the room can get a little loud. 
My experience was negative only because the 2 unit managers interviewing me were not interested at all. One proceeded to be on her phone throughout my entire interview while the other looked around the room while I answered her questions. I was their very first interview of the day so I cannot imagine they were tired. I understand if they lack interest but it was very unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a traditional interview process- nothing out of the ordinary. Got emailed to set up a meeting, interviewed, got asked for references the next day, and about a week later received an offer
Interview Questions: What are your goals?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Week after applying I received a call from recruiter. She was went over my resume and invited me to the Rn hiring event. Attended a hiring event where I met unit manager and staff RN. A lot of clinical questions asked.
Interview Questions: Who gets  tpa

title: HRBP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: Includes one phone call and two in-person interviews. I was called by someone in their general HR department to schedule a phone interview with a recruiter. There was availability the next day. The recruiter was very pleasant, and we connected after the interview even though I was not selected to move forward. It was a good experience.
Interview Questions: Strengths, great accomplishment, about my history.

title: Department Academic Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The recruiter did nothing wrong. My experience with her was quick, straightforward  and professional. My gripe is more so with the hiring manager. Totally unprofessional. I’m not sure if Cedars Sinai is going through a rebranding or culture shift, but whatever it may be, it’s apparent something is happening. I’ve had other peers who share similar experiences. Employees of any organization are considered “brand ambassadors” the day they accept an offer. It’s clear that the hiring manager is the result of unchecked bad behavior and unprofessionalism. I arrive 15 mins early to their offices, which is standard for most candidates. The interview was to take place at 9am and I had to wait 35 mins. My time is as valuable as anyone else’s. Often, when an employer is running behind, they let you know and apologize. The hiring manager seemly called me to a conference room for the interview and said nothing en route there. She did not tell me that it was a panel interview, which is fine for me since I enjoy interviewing. It would have been nice to know the interview set up before hand. It was obvious the hiring manager pulled 2 additional people to be in on the interview and they had absolutely no background in what I was applying for. They were asking unrelated random questions and I had to keep throwing my work experiences in, to steer the interview back on track. They asked me questions all at the same time. The most detrimental thing the hiring manager said to me was that she’s a “micro-manager”.  I pretty much checked out after that and was just hoping for the interview to be over. Very awkward and uncomfortable for no reason. I am a veteran of the military so I can handle pressure and shake-up. The total disregard for not only my time but the other candidates time as well.  I can only imagine how patients are treated. I’ll probably never apply with this organization again unless I hear of organizational change. As of 12/7/2019, it has been 72 days since my interview and I still haven’t gotten a response on if the position was fulfilled. I would have gladly declined if an offer was extended. This was probably the worst interview of my life and I’ve never had to leave something like this.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quite casual and respectful. I did not feel any pressure when I interviewed here, so I could answer questions more comfortably. I interviewed with assistant professor, postdoc scientist, senior research associates in the lab in order (1:1).
Interview Questions: Can you explain about (one of the things listed on resume)? What did you learn here? What was this project about?

title: Temporary Resource Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
HR manager was super friendly. Hardly any issues.
They called me and set up an interview appointment. Came in, and was ready to start working on my first assignment within 2 weeks
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Cedars-Sinai?

title: Research Associate II Interview

Interview Questions: How do you handle alternative outcomes and or failed experiments?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview

title: Social Media Interview

title: RN Interview

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview

title: New Grad RN Interview

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2019

title: Management Assistant II Interview

Applied online
Screening call with talent acquisition (this person was particularly not professional)
Skills assessment
In-person interview with the hiring manager

Never heard back from HR which is a red flag for me. It is crucial for employers to deliver a positive interview process for potential candidates in order to provide a positive impression of the organization. I will not consider this organization in the future nor recommend it.

Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  Two Interviews.  1st interview is an online program.   They ask 5 questions and you record your responses.  2nd interview is with the unit you are applying to.  The whole process took one month.

title: New Grad RN Interview

title: Research Administrative Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for called for a phone interview then had an in person interview. I had applied in October didn’t receive a response on whether I got the job until January. Long process..

title: New Graduate RN Residency Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: This was one of the strangest interviews I have ever been on. I came in 30 minutes before my scheduled interviewer, and they were already looking for me in the hallways asking if I had arrived. I was greeted by two people for the interview, and they began the interview right away. One individual did all of the talking and interviewing. While I was answering one of the questions that he had asked me, the interviewer pulled out his cellphone and talked on the phone. The other individual seemed disinterested since even before the interview started. She shook my hands at our greeting very flimsily, no grip at all. I was highly concerned for her to the point that I wanted to ask if everything was alright. It must have been an off day for these two individuals.
Interview Questions: The type of unit that I am the director of is _____ (it was a unit based on your interviewer, not a unit that you picked personally). What interests you about this unit?

title: Food Service Worker Interview

title: CRT Interview

title: Senior Citrix Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was over the phone with the hiring manager. Which went very well. Then came the face to face interview that consist of three parts. First met with the VMware team, then the Citrix team, then the hiring manager.
Interview Questions: What version of VMware do you have in your current position?

title: RN II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview total. HR called me and made an appointment first. Met in the unit with the unit director and 2 unit supervisors.  The interview was long and tense but everyone was nice and respectful.
Interview Questions: Details about last jobs. Type of patients!

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and went in for an interview a few days later. Very professional HR recruiting team.  Was mostly asked situational questions about previous work experiences. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: What is one goal you have accomplished and what is a new goal you have set for yourself?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online. They offer New Grad Residency program 4 times a year. Make sure you sign up for email job-notifications on their career site, because they stop accepting online applications (usually) after 50 applications. So once the first 50 applications have been submitted online, the job posting closes. The job posting is usually titled: New Grad Program - Registered Nurse I. 

2 rounds of interview. First was a one-way video interview where you record yourself. Second was an in-person interview with the unit-managers and/or nurse educators. Mostly behavioral/scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: A patient is informed that they have 6 months to live, what do you do?

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite straight forward. As long as you have knowledge of what they are asking for it should be quite simple. They are quite fair and would be willing to retrain you as needed.My only word of caution is that it is sometimes for a specific department. I think I applied to Cedar-Sinai as a whole but ended up getting called by the heart/cardiology department. I sadly didn't know much about cardiology and the interviewer stated that they could retrain me but it would put me far behind and set me up for failure in the future.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with extrapolating key passages out of a sponsor's package and writing that into an IRB form submission?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fast and very nice. Took an LVN test that same day. They made me fee comfortable . I'm waiting on my test results for the LVN test I took with them
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Portland, OR) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Over the phone. Interview started with basic details of the recent history of the company. A description of duties was given for the position. Filler because I need to provide 3 words beyond what was a short interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me what kind of accounts you reconciled?

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Went well and was asked questions about my availability and flexibility to take on many tasks. I was told I would hear from HR. I emailed and called to follow-up and was never contacted back, not even to say that the position had been filled, when I was specifically told I would be notified. Very frustrating.
Interview Questions: Asked if I was willing to drive to different locations for job.

title: Clinical Research Data Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It was a nice interview with a nice and polite lady and she pretty much asked about all my previous experiences and type of works I did before.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are a good candidate for this position?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online in November, interviewed a couple of weeks later in December. Interview lasted about 45 minutes with would be manager and immediate supervisor. Interview went well and was told I should hear back fairly soon since they were looking to hire someone ASAP. What followed next was 2.5 months of back and forth and excuses and 'delays'. I was constantly told by the HR rep that I was very well received and a top candidate for the position but there were just reconfiguring things within the department but don't worry, you're still in consideration. Then I was asked if I would be open to a temp position (which means no benefits and they can decide to not hire you permanently after miking work out of you for months). 

Finally I received a call from HR informing me that after all that back and forth and building expectations that they went with an internal candidate. From initial interview to final decision was a little over 2 months.
Interview Questions: Standard behavior/situational questions with some personality questions thrown in. No curveballs.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
3 step interview process: first is video, second is with educators, and third one is at the auditorium with directors from different units. 
Make sure to be early and prepare for the interview- behavioral and scenario based questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at this hospital? Why this unit?

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was applying from out of state so my interview was over the phone. It didn't take more than 30 minutes and it was mostly behavioral questions. Don't remember many clinical questions.
Interview Questions: Give a time when you noticed a change in your patient's condition and tell me what you did about it?

title: Associate Change Control Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward, nothing much to it. Applied internally. transferring from department. meet with the EIS recruiter and then manager and interview was very smooth just going over what I've done in my pass employments then met with another individual/associate
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself

What did you do in your previous department

title: Staff RN New Grad Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: 3 step interview: Video interview, then face to face interview with educators, then many unit managers who are all gathered in the auditorium. They skipped out on asking personal/ general interview questions and went straight into scenario based questions. Very focused on patient satisfaction
Interview Questions: How do you deal with a patient who discovered that they were dying

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: You have to take a skills test it's about 70-80 questions. The interview process I thought it was easy. She first explained the role of the new hire what they would do. (Ex: how many dr they have, hours). Then she moved on to the questions which was nothing different she just asked typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: If I contacted your employer what would they say about you?

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on a Wednesday evening and received an email the following morning for an interview. They only accept first 50 applicants and then application closes so you have to be on it. Interviewed a week later with hiring managers and it took about a week and a half to hear back from HR with a job offer. Go early for the interview. Late interviewees don't get hired. Trust me, I didn't believe it myself but it's true.
Interview Questions: Your patient just found out they have 6 months to live. How do you respond?

title: Research Scientist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: phone call: very simple; onsite interview: very relaxing as well; talk to a number of faculty members, the entire process is very smooth, and I got an offer in 2 months after first phone interview
Interview Questions: How much is your current salary?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (West Hollywood, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I applied when I was a new graduate nurse.  I was placed in a huge auditorium where many prospect employees were paired with a manager type RN to answer a set of questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Postdoctoral Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a 58 min skype interview, almost no behavior questions. Asked my background, research experiences, and I was asked to present my most recent research. The whole interview took 58 min, but didn't even noticed it took that long.
Interview Questions: show me your latest research project

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The process was smooth, but every department is different. Just be sure to be prepared to speak thoroughly on your background and experience. You may also have to come back for multiple interviews.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward. Asked me about everything I had on my resume and if I had a problem handling blood. They intentionally scramble terminology around to confuse you during the interview (regarding questions about passing cells). They brought up that they all sit together at lunch... like eating alone or with other people isn't an option. 100% high school atmosphere.
Interview Questions: do yo have issues handling blood?

title: Clinical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel from all of the laboratory sections. When you arrive, you will meet your selection board (usually two or three people, including the supervisor of the position and a representative of Human Resources). The team leader will tell you what to expect, and will explain that the board will be recording your answers for later review. Don't let this recording process distract you—it’s a normal part of the interview and necessary to make a complete assessment later on.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this profession?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy and felt more like a mini-orientation. We did some ice breaker activities but didn't answer and questions one-on-one. Definitely don't stress. We were told to come dressed professionally but almost everyone was dressed very casually.
Interview Questions: We weren't asked any questions, they just told us about the volunteer program.

title: Financial Care Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The process was:
Brief phone screen with the HR rep, pre-interview background check (going back 10 years + 5 references), typing/coding test, insurance quiz on the interview day, and interview. The process was long for a position in which they described is essentially just a "call center".
Interview Questions: What types of insurance have you previously worked with?

title: Nursing Communication Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: If you meet the requirements and get a call back for an interview  (I got a call back within a couple weeks for an interview) you will go to the HR dept and first take a computer assessment based on your computer literacy. You will then meet with an HR rep and go over the job description. Next you meet with a nurse manager or director of the nursing dept (I'm not good with titles) and you have the actual interview there. It's a lengthy process just keep a positive attitude. The interview was pretty easy general questions. Just be honest and show that this is where you want to be.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Associate Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process and the interviewer did not know a lot about this specific position. Even if I had been called back, I would not have been interested. She said that it would be about 2 months before they would know if they wanted me to move to the next round of interviews.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you worked in a team

title: Management Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (West Hollywood, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Long Process. Initially applied in October, first interview wasn't until January. Was not offered first position but was not notified until 2nd position became available. 2nd interview was in April and I  started in May. Long process but totally worth it!
Interview Questions: Stadard question, strengths weaknesses, excel skills

title: Clinical Research Specialist I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled to talk to two people, both for approx. 35-45 minutes. The first went normally, and I talked about my experience in interest in relation to the position, and she told me about the position and what was expected. The second interviewer, who was actually more involved in the position, however, barely gave me 10 minutes because she had a call. She also was incredibly unorganized and unprepared and knew absolutely nothing about my experience or skills. It seemed like they had already chosen someone and were interviewing just for the sake of looking fair.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working on various aspects of multiple studies at once and doing different things every day, including going to clinic?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: easy . a few questions about medication and math problems. had 2 interviews in a week  and received an offer a week later. interviews only lasted about 15 minutes each *tops* . received background check  and was woking within 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: what is Digoxin

title: Pharmacy Technician Per Diem Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Pharmacy manager contacted me through email and set up a phone interview. I was ready with a bunch of answers to your typical interview questions but I was asked to tell her about myself and why I should be hired. She was very nice and professional and shared a laugh or two so that made it feel comfortable. Wish I could've sold myself better though. Still waiting for a response after almost 4 weeks.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have in this area?

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially was contacted by the recruiter to obtain info on my background, work experience, education, location. I was then scheduled to interview with a staff of the company, who then told me about the company, job duties, hours, number of patients I would see, doctors I would work for, the training process. I was asked about my interest in the field and told i would be contacted back.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: brief, succinct interview with nurse manager. not too many questions asked. manly wanted to know if I had ICU experience. Overall the hiring process was very simple and to the point. I would recommend working here to others.
Interview Questions: why do you want to work in the icu

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Marina del Rey, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview process was brief and concise.  the interviewer was very respectful.  the overall experience was not stressful at all.  the intensity was not a factor for me and the atmosphere was very cordial.
Interview Questions: how long have you been a registered nurse

title: Clinical Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It took about 2 months from the time of application to the time they called me for an interview. I asked for a phone interview and they've accommodated me. Interview went well. The Interviewer handled the process very well, was interested in what I had to say. I enjoyed it. still waiting to hear from them.
Interview Questions: what interests you in Cancer research career

title: Medical Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer was very well-prepared and welcoming. Did an excellent job with introducing the team's work, then proceeded to ask questions about past experience, current interests, etc. It was a very welcoming environment, and professional. Took about 20 minutes, and I was told that I would be contacted by researcher manager. Follow-up took a few days, very prompt.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience in this field?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was out-of-state and therefore was conducted on an online video chat program called "Blue Jeans". The best part of the interview was the thoughtful questions from the members of the group. It was straight-forward. And there was an instant rapport.
Interview Questions: What is the biggest goal in your life? What do you wake up wanting to do each morning?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was flawless. First I met with a recruiter who walked me over to the unit for which I was applying. The hiring Manager and the Assistant Manager both met with me - almost like having a conversation with a good friend. Then they took me over to the unit and I met with 2 nurses who happened to be on the floor that day. The conversation continued in a very relaxed manner. They showed me around the unit and also the type of patients I would be encountering. Then I returned to HR and completed a brief assessment to ensure I was able to use a desktop PC. Both managers and HR told me I would hear back from them in 2-4 days. I received a call the following evening from the manager congratulating me and personally inviting me to work for CS.
Interview Questions: In your current job, do you involve the family members in rounds and patient care decisions? In what capacity?

title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and was called for an interview. The interview itself was in front of a panel of 4 people and ended with a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: What is something you are most proud of that you've achieved in your career?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: There is a phone interview with Human Resources, then an in person interview with HR after that there is an interview with the hiring manager and possibly the team. Once the interview done there the manager must go back to Human Resources
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here.

title: ACADEMIC MANAGEMENT ASSISTANT II Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted with three individuals. The panel used a battery of different questions on administration, and overall candidate understanding of research for human and animal subjects. Also was I willing to undergo training in regulations for human and animal subject research for competency in knowing the policies and restrictions. Overall a good interview.
Interview Questions:
Did I have any concerns with the use of animals in research.
What if any knowledge do I have of the regulations of using humans in research, women, children, prisoners and other protected populations.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview is very simple. HR asked some general questions about the commute, my interest, my plan for future development, etc.
The next two days, she called me and sent me email for onsite interview.
Interview Questions: Hiring manager asked almost every project in my resume. Some behavior questions such as working independently, emergency management. Then half an hour test on excel and sql.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Went to an interview career fair, then HR contacted me for a skype interview since I was out of state at the time, then proceeded with a skype interview with floor managers
Interview Questions: Q: Describe a difficult situation you had with a patient or family and how did you deal with it

title: Content Writer/Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I had five phone interviews, all of which were very pleasant. In between, I had spoken to HR on several occassions to arrange my references and paperwork. I was an out-of-town candidate, and after the fifth interview,  I was made an offer over the phone from HR.  Because I had still not met anyone in person and was hesitant to accept a job without doing so, I asked if it was possible to have an in-person meeting, prior to accepting their offer. Cedars flew me from my home and arranged three meetings with all of the respective individuals that I would be working with. In the following days, I reached out with thank-you's to the entire team and to HR confirming my interest in the position and the offer. After a week, two weeks, I reached out again via email and phone. No response. To this day, a year and a half later, I have still never received even a courtesy response from Cedars explaining their rejection.  I have the utmost medical respect for Cedars, but I question their HR professionalism.
Interview Questions: The writing and editing samples they had me do were quite contrary to the work they were asking of me; editing a celebrity gala piece  but I would be writing research copy. I had hoped I would be submitting and doing more congruent work.

title: New Grad RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received email invitation for the interview process a few days later. Interview process consisted of three interviews. The first is a video interview, and the next two are in person interviews, the last of which is with the nurse manager of the unit for which you are applying.
Interview Questions: Stressful clinical situation, why should we hire you, and a mix of behavioral and clinical scenario questions.

title: Associate Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: First there was a phone interview of basic behavioral questions. Then there was an extensive in-person interview consisting of a 10 minute presentation where you can choose any professional topic, which was done in front of one person but later two others joined. Then another interview quite similar to the phone interview.
Interview Questions: What was a goal that you set for yourself and eventually achieved?

title: Associate Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for the Associate Applications Specialist position in the Los Angeles office in October/November 2015. There were two total rounds. The first round was a 30 minute phone call with the recruiter. It mainly went over my resume, as well as some other behavioral questions. About two weeks later, I was invited into the office for an all-day interview. I began with a series of tests that evaluated me on skills in math, English and grammar, and logic. I was allotted three hours for the tests, so there was more than enough time (I finished in about 45 minutes). When I came back, all that was left was an hour for a presentation and an interview. We were told to come prepared to give a ten minute presentation on whatever I wanted. I used this as an opportunity to speak about an extracurricular that was both important to me as well as full of relevant experiences. My interviewer gave me a review of the presentation and proceeded to jump into a series of fairly standard behavioral interview questions.
The only negative comment about this process was how long it took them to give me an answer as to whether or not I had an offer. It took them a little over a month to get back to me and didn't really explain to me why it was going to take them that long.
Interview Questions: What is an accomplishment that you are proud of?

title: Surgical Tech I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received email rejection. Contacted by recruiter 2 days later for an interview. Basic computer skills test of 30 questions then a get to know you with the recruiter. 30 minutes later a walk over to the main hospital for interview with the human resources department. They were not clear until the actual interview of what position I was interviewing for. I thought I was there for a surgical tech position and I wound up interviewing for an endo tech position.
Interview Questions: Why do I want to work at Cedars Sinai, How do I handle stressful situations, Tell me about yourself. Pretty basic questions.

title: EpicCare Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: An extensive daylong interview (actually 6) with different teams and managers was exactly what I think every company should do. They thoroughly vet you and allow you to do the same. I was very pleased with this process. Cedars-Sinai somehow managed to take my already high expectations for them and still manage to blow me away. I would certainly consider reapplying if I decided to make the move to Los Angeles. This place is top notch and it was a great day. I really liked everyone who I spoke with and would love the opportunity to work with them. I wish my current organization was more like Cedars-Sinai.
Interview Questions: Standard questions, strengths and weaknesses, strongest abilities/areas.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then e-mailed the PI to tell them I was interested and send a cover letter. Interviews are in person. Got a soft yes from the PI, then went through a background check, the stardard references check, and drug testing. I was able to do the drug testing through someone (they chose) in my own city before I moved. It was hard to negotiate a slightly higher salary. They are stubborn about only giving the NIH minimum, even though Cedars-Sinai is at the crossroads of Los Angeles, West Hollywood, and Beverly Hills (an expensive area). My colleague moving in from the East Coast got moving costs partially reimbursed. I moved from another area on the west coast and did not.
Interview Questions: Interview questions will vary greatly by PI. They asked about my science background and skills.

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: This interview involved one on one interviews with 10-11 individuals in the department. Some were very informal and others involved 30 minutes of question/answer. Additionally, I was asked to give  1 hour formal presentation
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 1, 5, and 10 years

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: scheduled a phone interview, 10 min phone interview. interviewer had computer difficulties so he called 30 mins after scheduled time period. went well. unfortunately they offered the position to someone else that same day, so he called back and mentioned other similar opportunities that i might be interested in being considered for.
Interview Questions:
a challenge you faced and how you overcame it?
strengths/weaknesses?
why do you want to work at cedars?
what setting do you want to work in?

title: LVN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: LVN skills test passing score >80%.Group panel interview w/ team and/or Drs. Interview 1:1 with executive personnel. Interview w/ manager 1:1. 3 interviews in total. They try to accommodate all interviews in 1 day.
Interview Questions: A word that best describes yourself. What is a mistake that you made in the workplace on the past, and how did you overcome/fix it?

title: Scientist, Postdoctorate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: File application on cedars sinai website. Then got an email to schedule phone interview. Then onsite interview. It went well. Afterwards HR contacted me and I went through the screening. Another onsite interview with presentation. Finally got an offer from HR
Interview Questions: Describe your graduate research

title: Digital Product Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by recruiter on LinkedIn. Very warm and did a great job walking me through the job opportunity and scope of work. Second contact within a week to schedule initial call with hiring manager. Very upfront with feedback that they were looking for a more design oriented candidate.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite mobile application?

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very efficient hiring process and system. Did not have to wait long after being contacted by HR. HR interview first, then panel interview with hiring manager and assistant managers.
Interview Questions: Related to dealing with difficult clinical and social situations, and rationale behind your actions.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted CV and application.  Received email interview offer, asked to respond..  Went in for interview, first with Principal Investigator of study, then with administrative manager.  Interview took approximately one hour.  Felt very positive about the experience.
Interview Questions: What did I do at my last position?  Was I interested in the position as described?  Was I affiliated with any professional organizations?  Where did I see myself in five years?

title: Management Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Overall experience was not very good. I have heard that Cedars Sinai is the best employer in California. I find their interview process is very lengthy and there is lot of miss-communication among HR and other depts. They called me three times over the period of 3 weeks and after 2 weeks I have got rejections. Total time from HR phone interview and rejection mail took one and half month.They were keep calling me for face to face interview for 2-3 rounds and I was very positive that I will get the position but at last I got rejected. In every round they kept telling me you are overqualified for the position. Then my concern is why they were wasting my time and their time. I have declined one temp position because of this interview. It is so frustrating.My advice to HR please do not waste candidate time if they are not perfect fit. Your lengthy process creates false hopes.
Interview Questions: Simple questions, nothing complicated. What is your 5 year career plan.Why this position

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Received an e-mail after approximately 3 weeks of application. Scheduled a phone screening interview then had to make an appointment for in in person interview with HR and manager of the unit I applied to. Had to take basic computer skills assessment prior to the on person interview
Interview Questions: Why I'm leaving my current job

title: Evs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was told by an employee that they were holding a job fair and when I went down they were conducting interviews.  Luckily I came prepared, and had one of the best interviews.  The manager was friendly and made this surprise interview very comforting.
Interview Questions: Generally there were the basic questions - all generated from my resume.  One question that I found interesting and I believe I did a good job answering it - I was asked: Besides the money, why do you want to do this job?

title: Associate QA Test Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume online. Two months later received call back from HR rep to schedule phone screening with hiring manager and to ask preliminary questions (residency, salary requirements, etc.). Following week completed phone screening with hiring manager. A week after that, was called to schedule an -person interview the following week.  In-person interview process took about 3 hours and met/interviewed with HR recruiter, hiring manager and lead staff, and hiring managers team.
Interview Questions: Pretty standard scenario questions related to testing and liaising between several internal groups.  Most difficult to answer (and awkward) questions came from HR recruiter, which you can easily find from a Google search.

title: Bio Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Basic self- introduction questions and behavior questions. Some SAS coding question like how to merge, delete, select datasets.  Statistical questions like what is pvalue, means, medians, distributions, how to run linear/logistic models. And some SQL queries. Give an example how is your self learning ability.
Interview Questions: what is your 5 year plan

title: Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I found the job on Cedars-Sinai's website jobs listings.  I contacted the PI, who arranged a brief phone interview the next day.  The phone interview ended with an invitation to interview in person several days later.  The interview went well, however the PI explained that I was the first person he'd interviewed, so he'd need time to review others before getting back to me.  I contacted him a week later and he offered me the job, pending a background check.
Interview Questions: None.  Questions were mostly about past experiences and what skills I was comfortable with.  Interviewer stated that I was not expected to have all skills, and that appropriate training would be provided.

title: Pacs/Radiology Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had the 1st interview with HR and the lady was very nice and asked very typical and simple open ended questions about past experiences, skills, and qualifications.  The process took around 20-30min and wasnt difficult at all.  This was before the christmas holidays, causing delays but heard back for a 2nd interview.
Interview Questions: For the 1st interview there were none as long as you are prepared with your information and know what to talk about.

title: CRC Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
The processes now is : apply on line. HR does not helpful 
The rejections before the application reviewed by hieing management
Manager interviews and than a physician and a nurse or director.
Tour around and some times 2 interviews
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Surgical Technician III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went smoothly. Orientation was conducted in a professional manner. All new employees (regardless of position) are expected to wear formal business attire to the week-long New Employee Orientation (NEO) courses. Otherwise, they will be sent home and cannot begin on their start date until NEO is completed. NEO is held twice a month.
Interview Questions: Recommended to thoroughly prepare for any possible question.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very chill; just wanted to get to know you and my experiences; they asked about my previous work and skills and asked me about some examples of things i worked on
Interview Questions: N/A

title: IE Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was a panel interview. Multiple people came in and out and asked me questions. the hiring and interview process was not too difficult as it was just a panel interview. the panel interview consisted of multiple people coming in and ask me multiple questions.
Interview Questions: All questions were standard

title: Financial Care Specialist L Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted resume in early July. Got a call the following week to come in for an interview with six people (leads and supervisors). Very professional and at ease, made me feel good in the interview. Basic questions and overview of the position. About another week later after the interview got a call to come in for 2nd interview with the manager, and i tell ya this was one of the most polite ladies I ever met she shared with mee her vision of a manager/leadership as I was telling her my ultimate goals in the healthcare industry. She also shared with me what the leads and sups had to say about me and I was AMAZED what they had to say about me. Next thing I know manager gave me the unofficial offer (since HR are the ones who give you the contingent job offer) she love what I had to bring to the table and absolutely believe in me. Best interview i ever had
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got call for on site interview within a month. Interview lasted 1-2hrs with the principal investigator. Nice location and facility. I followed up afterward to thank the PI and only heard back 3-4months later at which point I already accepted another position. They ended up hiring someone else I knew after I declined.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Human Resources Temporary Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Met with a rep from HR. He was very nice and helpful. Gave me good advice. Interview went very smoothly and I was offered a job at Cedars-Sinai directly after our interview.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Preliminary Skills Test: I applied online and got an email a few days later. They gave me a link for an online test. The online test consisted of 5 ULTRA-HARD computational geometry/algorithm questions of which they wanted me to solve 4 in an hour and a half. I had to mandatorily use C++ which is really hard when you have to think about a new algorithm with NO clues (unlike a google-type onsite/phone interview).
Interview Questions: Area of overlap between two circles.

title: Logistics Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2014
