Interview Questions:
why do you want to work for cedars?
what is your weaknesses

title: Clinical Social Worker II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well as I interviewed with both managers (LCSW and RN) and the Director of the Department. I found them open and honest about what to expect on the units as well as clear about expectations of the job. I felt we established a rapport and understood each other clearly. I was offered, and accepted, the job and have no regrets.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I was initially called by a receptionist asking if I was interested in the position. I said I was, and we arranged a time for me to have an hour long Skype interview with the MD leading the lab. When the interview rolled around, my interviewer was very late and seemed flustered. She explained the position briefly, quickly grilled me on my knowledge (see below), and asked if I'd want to go back to graduate school. I said I do, in a few years, as I'd like to get some work experience first. She then said I probably wouldn't be a good fit since they want someone to stay very long term. 

She asked if I had any questions, I asked a few (what do you enjoy about your job, is there anything else I can answer for you, etc). After asking again if I had any more questions, she said she was late for another meeting. 

Overall, the "interview" was unprofessional and took a total of 9 minutes. The whole time she seemed like she didn't want to be talking to me, nor was she interested in what I was saying. I didn't want this job the second the interview was concluded, as a manager who acts like that in an interview most likely would act even less caring towards their employees.
Interview Questions: I was asked to talk about my scientific knowledge/experience, but my interviewer obviously hadn't looked at my resume to see I've worked in four very different labs. When I asked 'Which study would you like to know about?' she responded 'Whichever.'

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: 3 meetings in a 3 hour period. Staff was friendly and location was confortable and very professional.  Dress code is formal but everyone is very down to earth. You meet with a member of the team, the manager and the director.
Interview Questions: Everything was job related and short term and long term goals.

title: Revenue Cycle Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Laid back interview where we went over my resume and previous experience. I had applied to a temp agency (Apple1) but I still had to go to Cedars to have an interview there. I ended up earning 13.50 an hour for a Revenue Cycle job. The interview was fine but later I found out that Cedars was paying 25 dollars an hour to the agency for my work. Then I went on to work to the in-house temp agency that Cedars has and worked for 16 dollars. Then I quit to go to grad school.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to Cedars Sinai?

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with the HR. Later after few days I had an in person interview with couple of scientists. It was 1:1 interview for about 1 hr.
Interview Questions: He asked me about my experience and the skill I know and how my skill can be used for the current position

title: New Grad RN Program Interview

Interview Descriptions: After online application, some got called for phone interview.  If selected, most just advanced to the first round interview (~100) with an education coordinator (or CN-IV or NP).  Half were invited to the second round interview with a manager or CN-IV of a random unit.  They ended up hiring ~25 for each cohort.
Interview Questions: Have you ever broken a rule before?

title: Senior Data Reporting Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Two or three phone interviews, two in person interviews. Routine questions to ensure that I had the proper knowledge and skills to effectively do the job.
Interview Questions: There weren't really any difficult questions that I remember

title: Department Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Torrance, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online in March and didn't hear back until August. I got a call from the manager to come in for an interview and to take some tests. The tests were a typing test and a kind of listening test where I was read a paragraph and had to answer some questions about it. I was just told about the job, the department, and what they were looking for. The interview took about 30 minutes. Have yet to hear back from them.
Interview Questions: What is something unique from your past experience that qualifies you for this job?

title: Physical Therapist III In OPT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by a friend and was put in contact with the OP supervisor who contacted me via phone within a couple of days. She asked me general screening questions (mostly review of my resume) and then scheduled an in-person interview with me. She sent me a confirmation email to follow with directions and a map attached (very professional). When I arrived, she took me on a tour of the facility. All staff were very friendly and facility appeared to be very comprehensive. I was then interviewed by the PT supervisor for about 45 minutes with general questions regarding my resume, my experience, patient interactions, decision making etc. The interview flowed very smoothly. Then I interviewed with the OP manager who asked me similar questions regarding my resume and other typical questions (strengths/weaknesses, difficult situation and how did I deal with it, etc.) After those interviews, the OP supervisor followed up with me regarding any last questions and then told me that they were still interviewing candidates, but that I should apply online to have my information readily available.
Interview Questions: Most questions were straight forward (i.e. strengths/weaknesses, difficult moment). One question was when do I re-evaluate a patient to determine whether they are progressing or not?

title: Admitting Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: I went through a staffing agency. The staffing agency was really easy. They just wanted to get to know me and my pay. They low balled me. They asked for my previous pay at my old company and went a few dollars up. I found out others got a set rate from a different staffing agency. Do not be the first to state a number! I then went to interview at the hospital with the team lead, supervisor, and manager.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Cedars Sinai?

title: Systems Analyst Applications Support Interview

Interview Questions: Interview process still on going

title: Research Associate II In Data Management Interview

title: Environmental Services Interview

title: Administrative Services Coordinator II Interview

Interview Descriptions: I was brought in by the Dr. I worked for at Cedars.  I was interviewed by the Neurosurgery Dept. Director. There was a very detailed back groud screening that took some time.  HR called me in to complete more paperwork and take pictures for my ID's.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous experience

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2013

Interview Questions: Conflict with coworker

title: Sr. Analyst Interview

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 12 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviews were spaced very far apart, and then they apparently decided to hire me but forgot to tell me (their words).  Multiple interviews with multiple people across multiple departments
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work there, my vision for where I'll be in 5 years, Strengths/Weaknesses

title: Management Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was promoted from a temp position that I had worked in for about six months to management assistant position. The temp assignments I had were less than ideal, but necessary stepping stones to apply to a permanent position. The HR manager who hired me and then promoted me was wonderful and the process was very simple and straightforward.
Interview Questions: Where do you see your future with Cedars-Sinai?

title: Conference Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for an interview with the supervisor. There were pretty standard interview questions. After she narrowed it down to two candidates, she called me a week later to schedule a 2nd interview, which included a one on one interview with her boss, who asked very by-the-book interview questions, and a tour of the areas I would typically work in. Then I met with a few of the people I'd be working closely with which consisted of introductions, not really any questions. After the second interview, they started the background check process. This was done by an outside company, but coordinated by the HR department who became my contact for a week orso while everything sorted out. I also had to take a urine drug test and once those cleared, I was scheduled for a pre-employment physical and meeting with HR to fill out I-9 paperwork, etc. This took a few hours. Then a new employee orientation for a couple of days before beginning actual work!
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you tried the best you could and still failed.

title: House Keeping Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I asked if they still had positions , they took me tests from tests and i waited 3 days and they finally called me. I started working and it was easy !
Interview Questions: Why did i like working in this position ?

title: Applications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process. It took about two month. First there were a few extra questions sent to me via email after i submitted my application. After about a month, they emailed me again asking if i wanted to go in person and have interviews with the HR peson, Team Lead, Manager.  Two weeks after that i got the offer letter.
Interview Questions: Detailed questions about my previous research experience

title: EMR Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions:
The first interview was a phone interview with the Director. For a 30 minute interview, she spoke 20 minutes of it and made me feel like I wasn't worthy of the position. I was very surprised when her assistant called back to setup an in person interview with the team. They arranged my flight and hotel arrangements.

When I flew out to Los Angeles and arrived at the hotel, they asked me for payment for the room as Cedars hadn't taken care of it. Fortunately, I have family in Los Angeles and opted to stay with them instead of pay $250 for one night.

The next day, I met with HR first to discuss benefits at Cedars, then was my barrage of interviews. The very first was a 30 minute interview with two of the leads from the team, this went very well. The next was scheduled with the entire team of 10 or more people in a conference room for an hour. Because the manager was in that interview, I didn't have to be subjected to another 30 minute interview which was to follow. It's an all day thing at Cedars, be prepared.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Senior Histologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I applied in March and didn't hear a word back until August when I received a phone call asking if I was able to come in for an interview. The lead at the time emailed me the details but failed to respond when I asked her a question.  It was a group setting with the manager leading the meeting.  The leads of a few sub-departments were there as well.  They were nice and easy to speak with. A few weeks pasted before I heard back.  

It was an easy process, but very drawn out.
Interview Questions: Basic histology questions.  How do you interact with others.

title: Management Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Went through a 4 round in person interview process with the entire Research Team and MD's that I was assisting.  Overall the entire staff was friendly and asked mostly about my past work experiences and how to handle difficult situations.  Since I was assisting an entire research team the interview process took the entire portion of the afternoon.  Could vary depending on how many people you will be assisting/reporting to.
Interview Questions: Asked about past accomplishments, how to handle certain situations at work, conflicts with employees, standard interview questions.

title: Administration, Non-Medical Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The questions were basic and normal. There was nothing to be alarmed about. I interview with the manager and then interview with the director. They were pleasant and engaging. They tend to mislead prospects about the company culture.
Interview Questions: How do I handle difficult personalities?

title: EVS Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening after applying online and creating a profile. Very simple process. Interview was a panel of 4 then the next step is with the manager one on one. After completing the interview process, they called me within 2 weeks with an offer of 5% lower than I asked for. Pay is good at Cedars, so I was happy with the 5% fall.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your employer gave you too much to finish in your normal work hour?

title: Research Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I arrived at my interview about 30 minutes early and waited in the lobby until my interviewer came to bring me up to the interview room. I was expecting a 1:1 interview setting, however, the director of the lab surprised me by telling me I would have 5 separate interviews that day, each would last about 20 minutes. I first interviewed with the director for 15 minutes. He asked me basic questions such as my educational backgrounds, my work experience, etc. Then he asked me if I knew about the basic research his lab was conducting. The next interview was done conducted by an MD/PhD. The third interviewer was the lab manager. The fourth and and fifth interview was done together by a PhD and another Research Associate. This one was the hardest because the PhD grilled me about the different genes and experiments related to the research. I've worked in a research lab before, but it was focused on diabetes. This research was focused on a totally different subject. I answered everything to the best of my ability, and honestly. After all the interviews have been conducted, the director then told me that he would let me know by the middle of next week. However, he didn't extend an offer to me until two weeks later because he was still interviewing other candidates. I found the interview atmosphere to be a little intimidating, but all the interviewers were very considerate and understanding.
Interview Questions: Tell me everything you know about the genes and experiments that need to be conducted in this research.

title: Senior Exchange Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Okay this was a tough interview and it happened about 4 years ago and I am still sore over the whole experience.  I'm a pro at Exchange and have 10 years under my belt I thought I had this in the bag but I was asked questions that I have to look up after.  I must say after that interview it made me better engineer and I am ready now bring it!  I got past the phone interview and I heard that many Exchange candidates did not get past that this was a tough interview and there was a test onsite!  Be prepared to stay there and install fresh AD and Exchange.  The guy who interviewed me was to the point and did not let you off easy.  For dressing the recruiter told me to wear a tie and jacket or don't show up.
Interview Questions:
Only difficult questions from the team Exchange lead that i remember. I had a friend interview for the same position before me so I knew to brush up on the 3GB switch.  I got past my friend in the interview process and was asked additional items that I didn't know but know now.  This is what I remember. 
1. Difference between kernel memory and user memory? (I know this now)
2. What do you need to do to prepare for Exchange 2003 SP3 (that was a trick question)?
3. Exchange 2010 what is back pressure? (I know this now)
4. What is important in performance?
5. How do you measure IOPs?
6. What is RAID 10?
7. Where do you use RAID and why?
8. You need to know all Exchange protocol numbers!
The super hard questions I forgot what they were I was trying to take some notes but it was to fast.  There was harder questions that had nothing to do with Exchange but more of how you would manage a situation when the you know what hits the fan.  I am glad for the interview that i went threw and now i am more complete.

title: Research Scientist I Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Phone conversation with prospective employer followed by face to face meeting where i made a presentation of my previous work. Met 1 on 1 with the PIs of the institute and detailed discussion on work

Heard back in about a week
Interview Questions: What are your long term goals?

title: Research Scientist I Interview

Gave a presentation on the topic of my PhD dissertation. Was contacted again a month later to discuss salary requirements. Negotiations were rather swift (a few days), received offer a week later
Interview Questions: Other researchers asked specific questions on the subject of my PhD dissertation - was surprised to see that they knew considerably much about the subject, maybe they read up on it?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The director make it comfortable and easy to have an interview with him. He started the interview by explaining about the position, what they require from the candidate and asked me how I feel about it.
Interview Questions: What is your compensation requirement from the new job?

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: several panel interviews with all levels of staff and management: Administrative, RNs', potential co-workers, directors, and medical staff
Interview Questions: I was surprised that there wasnt any difficult questions!

title: Active Directory Engineer Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: The first step in my process was a Phone Screenn that took place with the Active Directory team lead.  Then there was a pannel interviiew with the team leads for different groups in EIS. A few days later I received a\n offer.
Interview Questions: How would you desgin a AD with 3 sites?

title: AD Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Be prepared for the technical interview and do not lie on your resume because they will ask random questions on what is on the resume.
Interview Questions: Describe the 5 FSMO roles

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Los Angeles, CA) in Jul 2009
Interview Descriptions: It was more like a discussion on the phone since they already knew about me. I needed also my recommendation letters (standard procedure). After the phone interview I was invited to give a seminar. The seminar audience consisted of about 20 specialists in my field and my present employer. After that I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: There were number of questions in my specific field of competence.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center (Beverly Hills, CA) in May 2008
Interview Descriptions: Interview was informal. Presentation given on any topic within limits.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to research cancer?
